title: Establishes program for familial dysautonomia and Tay-Sachs disease screening; authorizes department of health to provide grants
summary: Authorizes the department of health to establish a program for familial dysautonomia, Canavan's and Tay-Sachs disease screening and counseling and to provide grants and to enter into contracts with public and non-profit private entities to assist in such program; and provides that participation in such program shall be voluntary and all information shall be confidential.

       AN  ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to the establishment
         of a program for familial dysautonomia,  Canavan's  disease  and  Tay-
         Sachs disease screening and counseling

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-

    2  27-DDD to read as follows:
    3                                ARTICLE  27-DDD

    7          2771.  PROGRAM  FOR FAMILIAL DYSAUTONOMIA, CANAVAN'S DISEASE AND

   15    S 2770.   LEGISLATIVE FINDINGS AND DECLARATION OF  PURPOSE.    1.  THE
   16  LEGISLATURE HEREBY FINDS AND DECLARES:
   17    (A)  THAT  FAMILIAL  DYSAUTONOMIA,  CANAVAN'S  DISEASE  AND  TAY-SACHS
   18  DISEASE ARE DEBILITATING, INHERITABLE DISEASES THAT HAVE  AFFECTED  MANY
   19  CITIZENS OF THE STATE;
   20    (B)  THAT  FAMILIAL  DYSAUTONOMIA,  CANAVAN'S  DISEASE  AND  TAY-SACHS
   21  DISEASE ARE DEADLY  AND  TRAGIC  BURDENS  WHICH  ARE  LIKELY  TO  STRIKE

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03218-01-1

       A. 412                              2

    1  ONE-FOURTH  OF  THE  CHILDREN  BORN TO PARENTS BOTH OF WHOM ARE FAMILIAL
    2  DYSAUTONOMIA, CANAVAN'S DISEASE AND TAY-SACHS DISEASE CARRIERS;
    3    (C)    THAT  EFFORTS  WITH RESPECT TO FAMILIAL DYSAUTONOMIA, CANAVAN'S
    4  DISEASE AND TAY-SACHS DISEASE MUST BE  DIRECTED  TOWARD  THE  EDUCATION,
    5  SCREENING,   AND   COUNSELING  OF  CARRIERS  OF  FAMILIAL  DYSAUTONOMIA,
    6  CANAVAN'S DISEASE AND TAY-SACHS DISEASE;
    7    (D) THAT SIMPLE AND INEXPENSIVE  SCREENING  TESTS  HAVE  BEEN  DEVISED
    8  WHICH IDENTIFY THOSE WHO HAVE THE DISEASES OR ARE FAMILIAL DYSAUTONOMIA,
    9  CANAVAN'S DISEASE AND TAY-SACHS DISEASE CARRIERS;
   10    (E)  THAT  PROGRAMS  WITH  RESPECT TO FAMILIAL DYSAUTONOMIA, CANAVAN'S
   11  DISEASE AND TAY-SACHS DISEASE MUST BE BASED ENTIRELY UPON THE  VOLUNTARY
   12  COOPERATION OF THE INDIVIDUALS INVOLVED;
   13    (F)  THAT  THE APPLICATION OF METHODS OF SCREENING AND COUNSELING WITH
   14  RESPECT  TO  FAMILIAL  DYSAUTONOMIA,  CANAVAN'S  DISEASE  AND  TAY-SACHS
   15  DISEASE DESERVE THE HIGHEST PRIORITY; AND
   16    (G) THAT THE ESTABLISHMENT OF FAMILIAL DYSAUTONOMIA, CANAVAN'S DISEASE
   17  AND TAY-SACHS DISEASE EDUCATION, SCREENING, AND COUNSELING PROGRAMS WILL
   18  BE COST BENEFICIAL TO THE CITIZENS OF THE STATE.
   19    2. IN ORDER TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT THE PUBLIC HEALTH AND WELFARE, THE
   20  LEGISLATURE  HEREBY  DECLARES  AS  ITS  PURPOSE  THE  ESTABLISHMENT OF A
   21  PROGRAM FOR  FAMILIAL  DYSAUTONOMIA,  CANAVAN'S  DISEASE  AND  TAY-SACHS
   22  DISEASE SCREENING AND COUNSELING.
   23    S  2771. PROGRAM FOR FAMILIAL DYSAUTONOMIA, CANAVAN'S DISEASE AND TAY-
   24  SACHS DISEASE SCREENING AND COUNSELING.  THE COMMISSIONER  SHALL  ESTAB-
   25  LISH   WITHIN  THE  DEPARTMENT  A  PROGRAM  FOR  FAMILIAL  DYSAUTONOMIA,
   26  CANAVAN'S DISEASE AND TAY-SACHS DISEASE SCREENING AND COUNSELING FOR THE
   27  PURPOSES OF:
   28    1. THE ESTABLISHMENT AND OPERATION OF VOLUNTARY FAMILIAL DYSAUTONOMIA,
   29  CANAVAN'S  DISEASE  AND  TAY-SACHS  DISEASE  SCREENING  AND   COUNSELING
   30  PROGRAMS, PRIMARILY THROUGH OTHER EXISTING HEALTH PROGRAMS; AND
   31    2.  THE  DEVELOPMENT OF INFORMATION AND EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS RELATING
   32  TO FAMILIAL DYSAUTONOMIA, CANAVAN'S DISEASE AND TAY-SACHS  DISEASE,  AND
   33  THE DISSEMINATION OF SUCH INFORMATION AND MATERIALS TO PERSONS PROVIDING
   34  HEALTH CARE AND TO THE PUBLIC GENERALLY.
   35    S  2772.  COMMISSIONER; FUNCTIONS, POWERS AND DUTIES.  IN CARRYING OUT
   36  THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ARTICLE, THE COMMISSIONER SHALL HAVE THE  FOLLOW-
   37  ING FUNCTIONS, POWERS AND DUTIES:
   38    1.  IN  HIS  OR  HER  DISCRETION,  TO  MAKE  GRANTS  TO AND ENTER INTO
   39  CONTRACTS WITH, PUBLIC AND NONPROFIT PRIVATE ENTITIES FOR  PROJECTS  FOR
   40  THE  ESTABLISHMENT  AND  OPERATION  OF  VOLUNTARY FAMILIAL DYSAUTONOMIA,
   41  CANAVAN'S  DISEASE  AND  TAY-SACHS  DISEASE  SCREENING  AND   COUNSELING
   42  PROGRAMS;
   43    2. TO CARRY OUT A PROGRAM TO DEVELOP INFORMATION AND EDUCATIONAL MATE-
   44  RIALS RELATING TO FAMILIAL DYSAUTONOMIA, CANAVAN'S DISEASE AND TAY-SACHS
   45  DISEASE  AND  TO  DISSEMINATE  SUCH INFORMATION AND MATERIALS TO PERSONS
   46  PROVIDING HEALTH CARE AND TO THE PUBLIC GENERALLY;
   47    3. TO MAKE GRANTS TO PUBLIC AND  NONPROFIT  PRIVATE  ENTITIES  AND  TO
   48  ENTER  INTO  CONTRACTS  WITH PUBLIC AND PRIVATE ENTITIES AND INDIVIDUALS
   49  FOR THE PURPOSE OF EFFECTUATING THE DUTY PRESCRIBED BY  SUBDIVISION  TWO
   50  OF THIS SECTION;
   51    4.  TO  ADOPT,  PROMULGATE, AMEND AND RESCIND SUITABLE RULES AND REGU-
   52  LATIONS TO CARRY OUT THE PROVISIONS AND PURPOSES OF THIS ARTICLE; AND
   53    5. TO EXERCISE AND PERFORM SUCH OTHER FUNCTIONS, POWERS AND DUTIES  AS
   54  ARE  CONTAINED  IN THIS ARTICLE OR AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE CONFERRED
   55  OR IMPOSED BY LAW.

       A. 412                              3

    1    S 2773. COSTS. COSTS INCURRED BY THE COMMISSIONER IN  MAKING  PAYMENTS
    2  PURSUANT  TO  GRANTS  AND  CONTRACTS  AUTHORIZED BY SUBDIVISIONS ONE AND
    3  THREE OF SECTION TWENTY-SEVEN HUNDRED SEVENTY-TWO OF THIS ARTICLE  SHALL
    4  BE PAYABLE, AFTER SUBMISSION OF A VOUCHER CERTIFIED BY THE COMMISSIONER,
    5  UPON AUDIT AND WARRANT OF THE COMPTROLLER FROM MONEYS MADE AVAILABLE FOR
    6  SUCH PURPOSE BY APPROPRIATION.
    7    S  2774.  VOLUNTARY PARTICIPATION. THE PARTICIPATION BY ANY INDIVIDUAL
    8  IN ANY PROGRAM OR PORTION THEREOF ESTABLISHED UNDER THIS  ARTICLE  SHALL
    9  BE  WHOLLY  VOLUNTARY AND SHALL NOT BE A PREREQUISITE TO ELIGIBILITY FOR
   10  OR RECEIPT OF ANY OTHER SERVICE OR ASSISTANCE FROM, OR TO  PARTICIPATION
   11  IN, ANY OTHER PROGRAM.
   12    S  2774-A. APPLICATION; ADMINISTRATION AS TO GRANTS AND CONTRACTS.  1.
   13  A GRANT AUTHORIZED BY SECTION TWENTY-SEVEN HUNDRED SEVENTY-TWO  OF  THIS
   14  ARTICLE  MAY  BE MADE UPON APPLICATION TO THE COMMISSIONER AT SUCH TIME,
   15  IN SUCH MANNER, UPON SUCH FORMS,  CONTAINING  AND  ACCOMPANIED  BY  SUCH
   16  INFORMATION,  AS  THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL  DEEM NECESSARY AND, BY REGU-
   17  LATION, PRESCRIBE.
   18    2.  NOTWITHSTANDING THE PROVISIONS OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION,
   19  ANY APPLICATION MADE PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION SHALL AT LEAST PROVIDE:
   20    (A)  THAT THE PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES FOR WHICH ASSISTANCE UNDER  THIS
   21  ARTICLE  IS  SOUGHT  WILL BE ADMINISTERED BY OR UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF
   22  THE APPLICANT;
   23    (B)  FOR STRICT CONFIDENTIALITY OF ALL TEST RESULTS, MEDICAL  RECORDS,
   24  AND  OTHER INFORMATION REGARDING SCREENING OR COUNSELING, EXCEPT FOR (I)
   25  SUCH INFORMATION AS THE PATIENT (OR HIS OR HER GUARDIAN) CONSENTS TO  BE
   26  RELEASED;  OR  (II)  STATISTICAL  DATA COMPILED WITHOUT REFERENCE TO THE
   27  IDENTITY OF ANY SUCH PATIENT;
   28    (C) FOR APPROPRIATE COMMUNITY REPRESENTATION IN  THE  DEVELOPMENT  AND
   29  OPERATION OF ANY PROGRAM FUNDED BY A GRANT UNDER THIS ARTICLE;
   30    (D)  IN  THE CASE OF AN APPLICATION FOR A GRANT AUTHORIZED BY SUBDIVI-
   31  SION ONE OF SECTION TWENTY-SEVEN HUNDRED SEVENTY-TWO  OF  THIS  ARTICLE,
   32  ASSURANCES  SATISFACTORY  TO THE COMMISSIONER THAT (I) THE SCREENING AND
   33  COUNSELING SERVICES TO BE PROVIDED  UNDER  THE  PROGRAM  FOR  WHICH  THE
   34  APPLICATION  IS  MADE  WILL  BE DIRECTED FIRST TO THE BLOOD RELATIVES OF
   35  KNOWN FAMILIAL DYSAUTONOMIA,  CANAVAN'S  DISEASE  OR  TAY-SACHS  DISEASE
   36  VICTIMS;  AND  SECOND, TO THE HIGH-RISK POPULATION GROUPS IN WHICH FAMI-
   37  LIAL DYSAUTONOMIA, CANAVAN'S DISEASE AND TAY-SACHS DISEASE  OCCURS  WITH
   38  GREATEST  FREQUENCY  AND ESPECIALLY TO THOSE PERSONS IN THESE GROUPS WHO
   39  ARE ENTERING THEIR CHILDBEARING YEARS; AND (II) APPROPRIATE ARRANGEMENTS
   40  HAVE BEEN MADE TO PROVIDE GENETIC COUNSELING  TO  PERSONS  FOUND  TO  BE
   41  FAMILIAL DYSAUTONOMIA, CANAVAN'S DISEASE OR TAY-SACHS CARRIERS;
   42    (E)  FOR  SUCH  FISCAL  CONTROL  AND FUND ACCOUNTING PROCEDURES AS THE
   43  COMMISSIONER MAY DEEM NECESSARY TO ASSURE  PROPER  DISBURSEMENT  OF  AND
   44  ACCOUNTING FOR FUNDS PAID TO THE APPLICANT PURSUANT TO THIS ARTICLE; AND
   45    (F)  FOR MAKING SUCH REPORTS IN SUCH FORM AND CONTAINING SUCH INFORMA-
   46  TION AS THE COMMISSIONER MAY, BY REGULATION, REASONABLY REQUIRE.
   47    3. IN MAKING OR ENTERING INTO ANY GRANT OR CONTRACT PURSUANT  TO  THIS
   48  ARTICLE, THE COMMISSIONER SHALL:
   49    (A)  TAKE  INTO  ACCOUNT  THE  NUMBER  OF  PERSONS TO BE SERVED BY THE
   50  PROGRAM SUPPORTED BY SUCH GRANT OR CONTRACT  AND  THE  EXTENT  TO  WHICH
   51  RAPID  AND  EFFECTIVE  USE  WILL  BE  MADE  OF  FUNDS UNDER THE GRANT OR
   52  CONTRACT; AND
   53    (B) GIVE PRIORITY TO PROGRAMS OPERATING IN AREAS WHICH THE COMMISSION-
   54  ER DETERMINES TO HAVE THE GREATEST NUMBER OF  PERSONS  IN  NEED  OF  THE
   55  SCREENING AND COUNSELING SERVICES PROVIDED UNDER SUCH PROGRAMS.

       A. 412                              4

    1    S  2774-B.  CONFIDENTIALITY OF INFORMATION.  ALL TEST RESULTS, MEDICAL
    2  RECORDS AND  ANY  OTHER  INFORMATION  REGARDING  FAMILIAL  DYSAUTONOMIA,
    3  CANAVAN'S DISEASE AND TAY-SACHS DISEASE SCREENING OR COUNSELING ACQUIRED
    4  OR  MADE BY A PUBLIC OR PRIVATE ENTITY OR AN INDIVIDUAL UNDER THIS ARTI-
    5  CLE  SHALL BE KEPT CONFIDENTIAL, AND SHALL NOT BE ADMISSIBLE AS EVIDENCE
    6  IN AN ACTION OR PROCEEDING IN ANY COURT OR BEFORE  ANY  OTHER  TRIBUNAL,
    7  BOARD,  AGENCY OR PERSON; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT THE PROVISIONS OF THIS
    8  SECTION SHALL NOT APPLY TO:
    9    1. SUCH INFORMATION AS THE PATIENT, OR HIS OR HER  GUARDIAN,  CONSENTS
   10  TO BE RELEASED; OR
   11    2.  STATISTICAL DATA COMPILED WITHOUT REFERENCE TO THE IDENTITY OF ANY
   12  SUCH PATIENT; OR
   13    3. SUCH INFORMATION AS IS RELEASED BY WRITTEN  ORDER  OF  A  COURT  OF
   14  RECORD,  ISSUED  BY SUCH COURT AFTER RECEIPT OF AN APPLICATION ON APPRO-
   15  PRIATE NOTICE AND AN OPPORTUNITY FOR ALL RELEVANT PARTIES TO  BE  HEARD,
   16  SHOWING GOOD CAUSE FOR THE FOLLOWING REASONS:
   17    (A) OTHER WAYS OF OBTAINING THE INFORMATION ARE NOT AVAILABLE OR WOULD
   18  BE INEFFECTIVE; AND
   19    (B)  THERE  IS  A REASONABLE LIKELIHOOD THAT THE RECORDS WILL DISCLOSE
   20  INFORMATION OF SUBSTANTIAL VALUE IN A CIVIL AND/OR CRIMINAL PROCEEDING.
   21    IN ANY APPLICATION BROUGHT UNDER THIS SUBDIVISION,  UNLESS  THE  COURT
   22  ORDERS  ALL  PAPERS FILED UNDER SEAL, THE SUBJECT OF THE RECORD SHALL BE
   23  IDENTIFIED ONLY BY FICTITIOUS NAME, AND THE APPLICATION  AND  RESPONDING
   24  PAPERS SHALL NOT CONTAIN OR OTHERWISE DISCLOSE THE SUBJECT'S IDENTITY OR
   25  OTHER CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION.
   26    S 2774-C. REPORTS. 1. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL PREPARE AND SUBMIT TO THE
   27  GOVERNOR  AND THE LEGISLATURE AS SOON AS PRACTICABLE AFTER THE ENACTMENT
   28  OF THIS ARTICLE, BUT NO LATER THAN ONE YEAR FOLLOWING SUCH ENACTMENT,  A
   29  COMPREHENSIVE REPORT ON THE ADMINISTRATION OF THIS ARTICLE.
   30    2.  SUCH  REPORT  SHALL  CONTAIN  SUCH  RECOMMENDATIONS FOR ADDITIONAL
   31  LEGISLATION AS THE COMMISSIONER DEEMS NECESSARY.
   32    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   33  it shall have become a law, provided, however, that effective immediate-
   34  ly, the addition, amendment and/or repeal  of  any  rule  or  regulation
   35  necessary  for  the implementation of this act on its effective date are
   36  authorized and directed to be made  and  completed  on  or  before  such
   37  effective date.
